page.title: 01Valley north of Ludlow
page.content: The block takes in a section of the valley floor 2 miles wide & fairly flat.To the NW is the dip slope of Wenlock Edge & to the SE the slope of the next ridge.The 2 streams occupying the valley,the river Corve & Pye Brook are separated by land no more than 15m higher.The streams occupy incised channels,that of the Corve being 2m deep in the red marl.Roads use the slope on the valley edges,that to the N the more important B4368 & its branch south, the B4365, & the Gt Sutton lane in the S.The village of Culmington lies off the main road. There are 3 other groups of cottages,some of dark red sandstone & houses along the routes, with some farms.It is not very wooded nor are the hedges wide or tall Farming is sheep on the valley bottom.25- 33% of some farms is arable,rest sheep & beef
